SMW Subobject for UnchargedHigh Alchemy value: 10575Examine: A mysteriously imbued lucky ring.Is members only: trueIs variant of: Ring of wealth (i)Uses infobox: ItemImage: File:Ring of wealth (i) (uncharged).pngWeight: 0.006Value: 17625Version anchor: UnchargedRelease date: 18 September 2014Item ID: 12785

The ring of wealth (i) is an imbued ring of wealth created with a ring of wealth scroll and 50,000 coins. The imbued ring has all the functions of a ring of wealth with an additional effect of doubling clue scroll drop chance in Wilderness areas (excluding hard clue scrolls from Rogues' Chests and beginner clue scrolls) from any monster that can drop them in the Wilderness.

If you die with the ring, the imbue will be removed from the ring and converted to 50,000 coins. This is not affected by Protect Item in any way. In a PvP death, the coins appear in the inventory of the player who killed you; in a PvM death, the coins will instead go to your grave. It should also be noted that attempting to drop the ring whilst in PvP combat will result in the message "You must wait a few seconds before dropping this item."

Like other dragonstone jewellery, it can be charged to provide teleports, albeit only at the Fountain of Rune.

Treasure Trails[edit | edit source]

Tier Emotes STASH Location Items Cost
Master Flap North-east corner of the Death Altar 83,834[c 1]
  1. ^ The cost may be higher because of the variant of the item used. The base item is ring of wealth.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
7 April 2021
(update)

Imbued Rings of Wealth are no longer prioritised so highly for protection on death over other items.

6 December 2018
(update)

The item's inventory sprite was adjusted slightly.

31 August 2017
(update)

Partially charged versions of the item could now be turned into bank placeholders.

22 June 2017
(update)

The "Dondaken" [sic] teleport option while equipped was renamed to "Dondakan"

9 February 2017
(update)

The uncharged version was made darker to distinguish it from charged versions.

3 November 2016
(update)
  • The imbued ring of wealth can now be charged with teleports.
  • The "Rub" option was added allowing players to teleport.
25 August 2016
(update)

The "Boss log" option was replaced with a "Features" option.

20 November 2014
(update | poll)

The inventory models for imbued rings have now been updated to be a touch lighter than the standard version of the rings.

  • Prior to an update, the ring of wealth would lose all charges and teleportation functions when imbued.
